arm_group.description: Patients will receive physical activity feedback and be encouraged to achieve the daily goals of physical activity
Physical activity will be measured but not be informed to patients. She will receive usual care.

brief_summary.textblock:
Examine whether the measurement and feedback of physical activity increase the physical
      activity in women who underwent midline incision, gynecological surgery

clinical_study.brief_title: Physical Activity in Patients With Gynecological Surgery
clinical_study.condition: Women Who Underwent Midline Incision, Gynecological Surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Midline incision, gynecological surgery

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Cannot ambulate

          -  Anticipated long term ICU care

          -  Cannot wear accelerometer

          -  Anticipated discharge before postoperative day 5

intervention.intervention_name: Usual care except physical activity measurement

primary_outcome.description:
Baseline physical activity is measured before admission. Specifically, on presurgery day 3 and 4, patients wear accelerometer. The average physical activity of presurgery day 3 and 4 is calculated and be regarded as baseline physical activity.
After surgery, the average physical activity of postoperative day 4 and 5 is calculated. The ratio of the average physical activity of postoperative day 4 and 5 versus baseline physical activity is estimated.  The ratio is physical activity recovery rate.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
